results.title: Snow, sand and savages: the life of Frank Hurley
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley and Anthony Buckley Productions
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Frank Hurley - pioneer cameraman, war photographer, explorer, film director, writer, lecturer, broadcaster and Australia’s best known stills photographer. ‘Snow, sand and savages’ pays tribute to Hurley’s life and work and covers his first trip to Antarctica with Mawson and Shackleton, his 1919 footage of the Ross and Keith Smith flight from London to Australia, his 1920’s expeditions to New Guinea, and his coverage of both world wars. Some light relief is included with an excerpt from Hurley’s foray into feature films with ‘The Jungle woman’ in 1926. Narrated by Leo McKern and written by Joan Long.
results.title_for_label: Snow, sand and savages: the life of Frank Hurley

Some light relief is included with an excerpt from Hurley’s foray into feature films with ‘The Jungle woman’ in 1926. Narrated by Leo McKern and written by Joan Long.

results.title: Snow White and the seven dwarfs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David D. Hand, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: This film is regarded as a milestone in filmmaking as Walt Disney’s first full-length animated feature. Adapted from Grimm’s Fairy Tales, the film is the fairytale of Snow White, the beautiful princess whose life is threatened by the jealous Queen. Snow White finds safe haven with the seven dwarfs: Doc, Happy, Grumpy, Sleepy, Sneezy, Bashful and Dopey until a mysterious old woman arrives with a poison apple. Three years in the making, this feature propagated new developments in animation, using an unprecedented amount of man-hours in the creation of realistic movement on screen. This film is imbued in bountiful humour and music and of course striking animation. Originally billed as a children’s film, “Snow White and the seven dwarfs” is a film that from the outset had the ability to appeal across age brackets.

results.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
results.creator_credit: Virginia Lockwood, Bob Broughton, Earl Hurd, Dick Rickard, Otto Englander, Richard Creedon, Ted Sears, David Hand, Walt Disney, Webb Smith, Dorothy Ann Blank, Merrill De Maris and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Snow White, takes refuge in the forest in the house of seven dwarfs to hide from her stepmother, the wicked Queen. The Queen is jealous because she wants to be “the fairest in the land,” and Snow White’s beauty surpasses her own.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Snow falling on cedars [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Harry J Ufland, Ron Bass, Garry Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Universal Pictures, Ron Bass-Kennedy and Kennedy/Marshall Company
results.brief_description: Nine years after the bombing of Pearl Harbour, a small town in the Pacific Northwest still struggles with the troubling legacy of U.S. policies against Asian-Americans. In December 1950, just off the shores of San Piedro Island in Washington, a Japanese-American man Kazuo Miyamoto (Rick Yune) stands accused of murder after his close friend Carl Heine (Eric Thal) is found drowned in icy waters. As the trial gets under way, with Alvin Hooks (James Rebhorn) prosecuting Kazuo and Nels Gudmundsson (Max Von Sydow) defending him, reporter Ishmael Chambers (Ethan Hawke) covers the proceedings for the local newspaper. The trial strikes a deep emotional chord with Ishmael when he finds his ex-lover is linked to the case. As he investigates the killing he uncovers some startling clues that lead him to a shocking discovery. Based on the novel of the same name by David Guterson.
